items.content:
Note: We were previously working with Joey Choi on SQSP, if we could work with him again - he was great. If not, all good. Thank you!


Also note, SQSP is wanting to hop on a call with a signals expert on Tuesday, if this can be escalated to be assigned by EOD today if at all possible. Thank you!

Hi Armando, happy Friday! We just hopped off a call with our client Squarespace.


They are hoping to create a new 'Add To Wishlist' event, that only fires on one specific microsite (with either one page, or a few) as part of their upcoming campaign launching Weds - https://www.collection.squarespace.com/rickrubin (not live yet).


I confirmed they do use GTM. They just need this one new Pixel event made that fires when people land on the page, and tested and ready to go by EOD Tuesday ideally, Weds at the very latest.


We booked time with them on Tuesday 1/16 at 11:30 am - noon PT to walk through any Qs they have/testing/setup, if that'd work for you?


Really appreciate it! It was great working with you last time with Paycom. You were a huge help.


I'll send you the invite. If that time doesn't work, let me know when else might work on Tuesday.


Have a lovely weekend! - Zoe

Hi Zoe,

Confirming receipt of your ticket and following up from our call with SquareSpace earlier today.

Please comments between the lines below. Feel free to copy/paste these and share with the team at SquareSpace.


Standard VS Custom Events

There are two categories of events on TikTok:

  • Standard Events: These are actions with predefined names created by TikTok. Standard events are supported across all TikTok integration tools today and can be used for reporting, optimizing for conversions and building audiences. 
  • Custom Events: These are actions that TikTok partners can define themselves beyond the predefined standard events list. Custom events can be set up with Event Builder in Events Manager or reported directly via the Pixel and Web Events API. Custom events are available for reporting and audience creation purposes. Optimization is not supported at this time.

Implementation

Given that custom events are available for reporting an audience creation but do not have the option to optimize, the recommendation is to implement a standard event along with a custom event. The purpose of this redundant setup is to give you the ability to generate reporting and create audiences based on the custom event, while the standard event will provide a general event to optimize your campaigns at the time of campaign setup.

Example - https://www.collection.squarespace.com/rickrubin 
To implement the above setup at the microsite located above, we will use AddToWishlist as our standard event. Since we want to track page landings on our microsite, we can name our custom event RickRubin_PageLanding (see Additional considerations & specifications section). Assuming the base pixel (C2ENC2QQV140ORDIO960) has already been added to the microsite, the AddToWishlist event should be fired as shown below:

Followed by their custom event:

The above events should be set up in their own separate GTM tags. You can replicate this setup for any other microsites in the future. You can use the same standard event but update the name of your custom event to reflect your new microsite.

Audience Creation

Once you have implemented your custom and standard event side-by-side, and you have recorded over 1,000 custom events, you will be able to create an audience from your custom events. See here for more information on audience creation.

Custom Event Reporting

Because of the nature of custom event reporting, we need to create a custom report in order to be able to access these metrics.

  1. To generate a report for your custom events, from your Ads Manager account, navigate to Analytics > Custom Reports. 
  2. Next, click the Create button, followed by Custom report.
  3. Click the Metrics tab and deselect all checkboxes for now.
  4. Click the Dimensions tab
  5. Under Campaign, make sure to select Campaign name and Campaign ID
  1. Under AdGroup, make sure to select Ad Group name
  1. Under Assets, make sure to select Custom Event Type

Lastly, go back to the Metrics tab and scroll down to Page event and select it. This will begin populating your report. You should see a row for each of the custom events captured under the pixel on your site and within the campaign and ad group specified.

Regarding your recap/follow-up questions:

  • If same exact event code is on two microsites, if there’s a way to isolate URLs/sources to break out data. (If not or not sure, we can recommend for now they keep that event/code isolated)

I took a look at the TTAM dashboard, currently, the dashboard can break down event source by top-level domain, which means any and all events coming from subdomains of squarespace.com, would rollup to this top-level domain.

They can follow the implementation steps above for any microsite. By doing so, they can use a new custom event name to keep separate from previous microsite but still leverage the learnings captured by the same shared base pixel.

  • How to set up Standard event with GTM (they'll likely start with Add To Wishlist for this setup, as of their last email)

See implementation section above.

  • How to setup a custom event and pair a Standard event with a custom one.

Step 1 - ensure the base pixel is firing on the microsite/landing page

Step 2 - fire the standard event

Step 3 - fire the custom event

Step 4 - create custom report to see custom event metrics

  • Creating audiences off of custom events?

See link under audience creation section above.


During the call, the team asked about Optimization for custom events. As of today, there is no ETA available for this feature. Please check this document periodically for updates on this topic.



I will close this ticket for now since we had the call with the advertiser and we provided our recommendations. Please feel free to reopen if they have any other questions regarding technical implementation.

Best,
Armando

[Conclusion] 
Advertiser needed guidance on setting up custom events. Had call with CSM and Advertiser to go over implementation details. Provided link to resources.
[Status Update] recommendations provided, ticket reopened by CSM but no additional asks or follow-ups.

Hi Armando! 


Quick semi-urgent Q. Squarespace just launched their campaign today, and I'm seeing only 2 'add to carts' logged, but 300+ destination clicks, at $400+ spend thus far.


Could you help QA the event and if it's firing/tracking correctly?


It's currently saying it's ~$200 CPC, versus the other test traffic campaign we're running concurrently which is driving $0.90 CPC.


Site: https://collection.squarespace.com/rickrubin

Campaign URL: https://ads.tiktok.com/i18n/perf/adgroup?aadvid=6903973459693404162

Ad group ID: 1788373655429137

UPDATE: We've determined they've just used the wrong URL in their ads (accidentally added WWW in), so we should be all set here.


Thank you anyway! We should be set.

Hi Zoe,

Ok, great to hear. Thanks for letting me know!

Best,
Armando

[Conclusion] 
Advertiser needed guidance on setting up custom events. Had call with CSM and Advertiser to go over implementation details. Provided link to resources. CSM confirmed everything is working as intended.

Hi Armando,


We just got this note from Squarespace.


I'm going to dig into it, but just thought I'd throw it your way as well, in case you think there's any possibility of a tracking issue here. Thanks!


As we wrapped up our Collection campaign with Rick Rubin, a directional metric we look at is # of Trials. When exporting data for the standard event "Submit Form" (tied to our internal trial event) we noticed that only the UK campaign yielded trials. We checked with our team to understand if it was a set-up issue on our end, but we're seeing that the flow in staging and the trial event fires properly and should be firing for all countries. Would you be able to look into if this reporting is correct or if there is an issue? Thank you!


Tomorrow I can share more info here after digging in myself.

Hi Zoe,

Confirming receipt of your follow up.

For the purpose of troubleshooting, I would want to ask them the following:

As we wrapped up our Collection campaign with Rick Rubin, a directional metric we look at is # of Trials. When exporting data for the standard event "Submit Form" (tied to our internal trial event) we noticed that only the UK campaign yielded trials.

  • Where was this data exported from? The TTAM dashboard? Is there a screenshot of the report they are comparing TikTok's report to?

We checked with our team to understand if it was a set-up issue on our end, but we're seeing that the flow in staging and the trial event fires properly and should be firing for all countries.

  • How was the TikTok pixel set up to fire? And are they using the same pixel for all countries? If the answer to the 2nd question is yes, then our reporting would not be able to provide them a break down by country. The only way to have such breakdown would be to have a pixel for each country, which is not practical.
    I took a look at their event data. The pixel page referrer tells us the visitors' previous page prior to the event being fired from the page under the pixel_page_url. We can see here that there were some visitors from other countries (the green cells), but they were then redirected to the template pages and their taxonomy is <template-name>.squarespace.com/config. 

From TikTok's reporting POV, everything is rolling up into squarespace.com.

Would you be able to look into if this reporting is correct or if there is an issue?

  • Please forward the report they are referring to above once you have this info.

Thanks,
Armando

Hi Armando,


I just heard back from the client here!


1. How was the TikTok pixel set up to fire? Any additional details are helpful.

  • The TikTok trial event fires on all trials and is the same for all countries.


2. Are you using the same pixel and same event firing setup for all countries?

  • Yes the same pixel and event fires for all countries.


3. It was the same exact landing page across both ad accounts/all regions, correct?

  • Correct


4. Are you only looking at TikTok's custom report here or any internal reporting to cross compare? 

  • Tiktok reports get piped into our internal reporting, but looks like our internal reporting reflects the same numbers we're seeing on Tiktok reports.


When working in the custom reports tool for these campaigns, we're not able to parse out the conversions (Submit form + Impressions) by geo (screenshot attached). Would your team be able to export this data?


It could be the case that our other 'Collection' campaigns didn't yield any trials, but it seems weird that in the US where we invested the most didn't yield a single trial. Please let us know if there are any updates! Thank you.


She did not send an internal report here but confirmed it matches our '0' results for Submit Form. I didn't send your screenshot, since they only targeted the UK, NZ, CA, AUS and the US, so I felt confused on why there'd be es-, fr-, de-, it- pre-urls.... 


I wonder if I could go through the flow and start a trial and see if it tracks through up until the last steps... let's see.... okay:


1st step: https://collection.squarespace.com/rickrubin/ (pixel live)

2nd step: https://www.squarespace.com/templates/transmission-fluid-demo (pixel live)

3rd step: Press CTA (Start with this design) button on prev page [landing on Create your account page] (pixel but no events showing?) - see screenshot

4th step: Signed up with my Gmail (no card needed) (pop up on same URL as 2nd & 3rd steps) - see screenshot

5th step: It took a second to load and then landed me on my template page - no pixel (I see Meta fired 4 events correctly, including lead/purchase) - see screenshots in next attachment

So it appears something in our flow broke and we lost tracking ability.... would love your thoughts and suggestions here. Thank you! 


Also, happy to hop on an internal call too, if that's easier.

Side note: They just launched a $1M+ campaign today, and will likely want this fixed ASAP, if we can move fast on this.


Thank you so so much!
Sorry! haha I know it's a lot. Happy to break it down on a quick call now/later to screenshare if needed. Thank you

Hey Zoe,

It's a bit all over the place. Give me some time to try to make sense of all of it and I'll send recommendations over once I have an update.

Best,
Armando

Hey Zoe,

Thank you for providing the info above!
You actually got this right from the notes you attached to the ticket yesterday! ?????

I just went through the flow and indeed, the SubmitForm event is not firing at all.

The reason for that is because the base pixel is not being loaded on that page. Without the base pixel, you cannot use any of the functions to fire the event and implement advanced matching.

So this means that if this is the US site, then it makes sense that no SubmitForm events were ever captured because none were ever fired.

Good news is the fix is as simple as adding the TikTok base pixel back on the page.

If you could relay this information to them that would be great. I am still good to join a call with them as scheduled if they want to discuss it.

Best,
Armando

[Conclusion] 
CSM reopened ticket after advertiser reached out with an issue that prevented them form seeing events tracked. After inspection, discovered they did not implement event code correctly. Sent instructions and confirmed issues were corrected.

items.content:
Hi there! Our client Squarespace is launching a campaign tied to a microsite (https://www.collection.squarespace.com/rickrubin) that's set to launch next Weds 1/17, morning ET.

They're asking for help creating a custom event pixel to track landing page views to that specific page (aka: View Content)

They're also asking if that microsite would be covered by the existing pixel, or if a new one would need to be made.

I'm hopping on a call with them shortly to discuss, and may need support on Tuesday 1/16 with making sure this is all squared away before launch. 

Thanks!

Zoe
